nl.ecoquest.vk.actor

Interface Actor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Animal, Bear, Fox, Grass, Human, Hunter, Rabbit

    public interface Actor
    The actor interface makes sure every actor at least knows how to act, where it is on the field and if it's active or not.
    Version:
    2015-02-01
    Author:
    Jeroen, Joel en Angela

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act(java.util.List<Actor> newActors)
      Make this actor act - that is: make it do whatever it wants/needs to do.
      Field getField()
      Gets the field on which the actor resides.
      Location getLocation()
      Gets the current location on the field.
      boolean isActive()
      Check if the actor is active or not.
      void setField(Field field)
      Sets the field on which the actor resides.
      void setInActive()
      Sets the actor inactive.
      void setLocation(Location newLocation)
      Place the actor at the new location in the given field.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Check if the actor is active or not.
        Returns:
        true if active, false if not active

      • act

        void act(java.util.List<Actor> newActors)
        Make this actor act - that is: make it do whatever it wants/needs to do.
        Parameters:
        newActors - A list to receive newly born actors.

      • setInActive

        Sets the actor inactive.

        Gets the current location on the field.
        Returns:

        Place the actor at the new location in the given field.
        Parameters:
        newLocation - The actor's new location.
